@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q5: Measures should still be in place to cut the number of cases, extinguish the outbreaks and in a way make it harder for the virus to mutate further (as this is done when the virus spreads and replicates during the ongoing transmission).

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q5: the vaccination maximizes our protection from severe disease and hospitalization. The infection though is still possible, especially with a much more infective and transmissible Delta variant.

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q5: We are not over panicking. While the vaccination proceeds, there are still people around us who cannot be vaccinated or have not yet been covered in the national vaccine rollout.

By vaccinating ourselves we protect them and ourselves.

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q4: As the composite score does include test positivity, this does take into account the testing rate at least to an extent. The inclusion of testing data in the model projections depends on each model included in the ensemble forecasts. More info here:  https://t.co/DL4hckJ7gi

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q4: The composite score contains testing data (test positivity), which is provided to ECDC by the Member States, and which includes both PCR & antigen tests (but there might be variations in the data that the countries are able to include and report).
@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q3: The composite score method is best described in the Annex 2 of the 15th update of ECDC’s Risk Assessment for COVID-19: https://t.co/LsYogF5rI9

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q2: No, to date the composite score is only used in the surveillance reports & risk assessments. Maps in support of the Council Recommendation are based on data on incidence of cases, testing rate & test positivity only.

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q1: The final score between 1 and 10 is split evenly into quintiles to produce the categories used. A higher score indicates an epidemiological situation of greater concern. The method is described in Annex 2 of the 15th update of ECDC’s RRA: https://t.co/LsYogF5rI9

@marceloverdijk @hugodejonge Q1: 
weekly epidemiological score is derived from a combination of the absolute value & trend of intensity indicators (test positivity and total case notification rates) & severity indicators (case rates among people 65+, hospital or ICU admissions or occupancy & death rates).

urls.title: COVID-19 in children and the role of school settings in transmission - second update
urls.description: The aim of this document is to provide an update on the knowledge surrounding the role of children in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the role of schools in the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing in particular on the experience in EU/EEA countries since the beginning of the pandemic. This document also addresses transmission to and from staff in school settings, school-related mitigation measures including risk communication, testing, contact tracing, and the effectiveness and impacts of school closures.

urls.title: Overview of the implementation of COVID-19 vaccination strategies and deployment plans in the EU/EEA
urls.description: This report provides an updated overview of the progress of national COVID-19 vaccination strategies in EU/EEA countries, including updates on: vaccine uptake overall and by target group; vaccination strategies and policies in place; vaccine acceptance and hesitancy; and challenges countries face with increasing uptake and good practices to mitigate these challenges.
